body:
LOL I knew it! They're trying to get rid of Java Edition already. This is step 1! Pretty clever, they want to make everyone get a MS account first, so they can make more money, and then force them all over to Bedrock Edition!

Too bad I don't usually log in anymore anyway.

body:
> If you don’t make the move, in several months you won’t be able to log in anymore – which means you won’t be able to play either.  

Isn't it funny how you can buy something from one company and 8-9 years later if you don't dance to a completely different company's tune, you've lost what you've purchased?
body_html:
If you don’t make the move, in several months you won’t be able to log in anymore – which means you won’t be able to play either.

Isn't it funny how you can buy something from one company and 8-9 years later if you don't dance to a completely different company's tune, you've lost what you've purchased?

body:
it doesn't. people fear being forced into bedrock later down the road.

It's all still DRM though, be it Java log-on or MSSO. Microsoft or Mojang could always force it to happen, as they have ultimate control over it... This is them just being friendly about it & trying to limit the outrage of players.
body_html:
it doesn't. people fear being forced into bedrock later down the road.

It's all still DRM though, be it Java log-on or MSSO. Microsoft or Mojang could always force it to happen, as they have ultimate control over it... This is them just being friendly about it & trying to limit the outrage of players.

body:
Eventually Java edition will be "deprecated".  

Meaning that your login for that won't work.  Because Microsoft has kindly reminded you, for about 6 months or so, that it would no longer be supporting that product.   But Minecraft 2 is now available through the App Store, so there's a solution, consumer!  

It's like the scene in "Office Space".  Microsoft will [fix the glitch](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zqjQDP9KX6E).  They won't flat-out cancel Minecraft JE.  It just "won't be supported".
body_html:
Eventually Java edition will be "deprecated".

Meaning that your login for that won't work. Because Microsoft has kindly reminded you, for about 6 months or so, that it would no longer be supporting that product. But Minecraft 2 is now available through the App Store, so there's a solution, consumer!

It's like the scene in "Office Space". Microsoft will fix the glitch. They won't flat-out cancel Minecraft JE. It just "won't be supported".

body:
> all of our games will require a Microsoft account to play – including Minecraft Java Edition. Why?

Because they're greedy fucks that don't like competition, don't like Linux, don't like open source, are doing their damned best to kill of a competitor to their machine that squeezes money out of children (and their parents).  They can't stand freedom or letting people touch their toys, despite the years of being propped up by the community that depended upon it.
body_html:
all of our games will require a Microsoft account to play – including Minecraft Java Edition. Why?

Because they're greedy fucks that don't like competition, don't like Linux, don't like open source, are doing their damned best to kill of a competitor to their machine that squeezes money out of children (and their parents). They can't stand freedom or letting people touch their toys, despite the years of being propped up by the community that depended upon it.

body:
Not really true, you can download and make your own packs for win10 and mobile (not console)

Unfortunately, the packs that exist for bedrock are rare and far in between. All the good packs are on the marketplace.

With that said, there is a android app that converts a Java pack to a bedrock pack, and it works half decent
body_html:
Not really true, you can download and make your own packs for win10 and mobile (not console)

Unfortunately, the packs that exist for bedrock are rare and far in between. All the good packs are on the marketplace.

With that said, there is a android app that converts a Java pack to a bedrock pack, and it works half decent

parent.body: Eventually they'll probably ignore it and it won't work at all anymore. They'll try to force everyone to use Bedrock because you have to purchase everything for it, whereas on Java you can download something or make it yourself and they don't get more of your money.
parent.body_html: Eventually they'll probably ignore it and it won't work at all anymore. They'll try to force everyone to use Bedrock because you have to purchase everything for it, whereas on Java you can download something or make it yourself and they don't get more of your money.

body:
I mean....

They just added WSL (windows subsystem for Linux) to windows 10, so there's that.

It's a Linux subsystem for windows.

They also ported MS Edge to Linux, not that anyone uses it, but they did port. If they port office over then they'll get some attention.
body_html:
I mean....

They just added WSL (windows subsystem for Linux) to windows 10, so there's that.

It's a Linux subsystem for windows.

They also ported MS Edge to Linux, not that anyone uses it, but they did port. If they port office over then they'll get some attention.

parent.body:
> all of our games will require a Microsoft account to play – including Minecraft Java Edition. Why?

Because they're greedy fucks that don't like competition, don't like Linux, don't like open source, are doing their damned best to kill of a competitor to their machine that squeezes money out of children (and their parents).  They can't stand freedom or letting people touch their toys, despite the years of being propped up by the community that depended upon it.
parent.body_html:
all of our games will require a Microsoft account to play – including Minecraft Java Edition. Why?

Because they're greedy fucks that don't like competition, don't like Linux, don't like open source, are doing their damned best to kill of a competitor to their machine that squeezes money out of children (and their parents). They can't stand freedom or letting people touch their toys, despite the years of being propped up by the community that depended upon it.

body: mostly because minecraft's account security is total trash, doesn't mean I want MS's either, both are shit for different reasons
